reviews.review_msg: If you want to get a good grade and learn the material, then you will need to take Jordana.

Genuinely cares about her students. Gives a detailed outline, replies to emails promptly and provides a study guide for the exam. The paper topic is interesting, and she makes sure all assignments correlate to the paper, making you start it beforehand. Understanding and gives students the benefit of the doubt for missing class. Defs take again!
One of the best profs I've had at SFU. Knowledgeable, friendly, concise lectures, and clear guidelines. Definitely recommend.
She only reads her notes on class, and her notes are copied exactly word by word from textbook. You don't need to go to class.
She's awesome. Super chill class only consisted of a midterm, paper, final and participation marks.

Jordana was one of the nicest profs I have ever had at SFU. She goes out of her way to make sure students are doing well. Assignments are very fair and marked fair too. She tries to make classes interesting. Recommend taking a class with her.

Jordana is the best prof I have ever had at SFU. She is so unbelievably kind and welcoming and really strives to make sure everyone understands each concept. She has a clear love and passion for crim and teaching, which makes lectures much more enjoyable. I will be taking any class she teaches from here on out!

3 hour lecture on fridays..... She always thinks she is right, and makes obvious mistakes in lecture. May be a lack of experience, but overall, not a pleasant course. She told me at the end: "People think that this is an easy course, but its actually difficult". Science major, put more time into this course than calculus. Disapointing

she is really nice and every helpful, i am so suprised how everyone found her so tough but i found her class to be the easiest in my semester. She is very fair and interested in the material.  recommend her!

I wish the kids in my class would appreciate what they have in Jordana. She is a genuine person who clearly puts her heart into each lecture, and gives us info we are both interested in, and that we can use in later classes.  Yeah, you have to put in the work.  But that just makes us better critical thinkers.  Highly recommend this brilliant woman!
She is so horrible. Her course content sucks. Her class average is so low that i wonder if she is a sadist and likes to inflict pain on her students. Dont take her class mates!

The whole lecture is useless if you don't take notes.  The exams are based completely on the lecture notes. This is supposed to be a good news! But when you see 10+ pages per lecture, you will not think so. The exam grade is also weird, when you think you will get 70%80% accuracy based on your memory of the lecture notes, you actually get 5060%.

Jordana has 3 hour lectures. In each class there are 10 questions that make up a quiz which are asked throughout the class so students stay. She is very straighforward the tests are also easy. However she's a hard marker. You might finish a Test thinking you got an b+ or A but you will end up getting a c or c+.
Takes quiz before explaining. Sometimes I don't get the readings but proffessor doesn't explain.

The worst class I have been to.  She basically reads off her slides and the slides are just points from the book that a 7th grader can make. You would learn so much more if you bought the book and just read it yourself.  I don't know why this woman is a professor. She can turn any good course into a boring one. Credits for that.

Straightforward expectations and easy enough to understand. Not the most experienced prof, but if you ask for clarification, she'll give it to you.  Lectures aren't recorded so you better go to class or make friends.

She's an alright professor, its quite obvious its her first time teaching but she tries, lectures are mandatory but basically just a summarization of the chapter. She mainly reads out of the textbook and verbalizes the examples already provided.
